Reviews.Title: Would give 4.5 stars - happy purchase - great if you don't need bells and whistles in the TV
Reviews.Author: JourneyOn "Virginia"
Reviews.Content: Own the 35" model of this TV which has same positives and/or negatives often described - outstanding picture, only 2 HDMI sockets, basic sound, and the often-complained-about no audio out jack. Happily for me I just want to watch TV and Blu-Rays, so sound was improved for movies by purchasing a Yamaha YAS sound bar and attaching to a "smart" Samsung Blu-Ray player, e.g. when playing movies the sound goes through the sound bar (make sure the TV sound is turned down to zero or there is an echo effect.) Perfect solution for me - the TV sound is perfectly fine when watching "regular TV" - just wanted rich sound when watching films. In any case, for movies IMO with a picture of this quality and set-up ease, I'd buy this TV again - re movies bigger is definitely better. Did spend some time in the Picture - movie mode tweaking settings (Movie mode darkens screen for viewing in a dark room so less glare/eye strain, roughly Brightness, Color set to around 50, Contrast 70-80, Dynamic Contrast set to Medium but all this depends on taste, and personal preferences). Worth reading manual! Very enjoyable watching movies more or less the way they were meant to be seen, "big screen", it's like seeing your DVDs etc. for the first time.  For me no real negatives, a swivel base would have been nice, and usual warnings about LED burn-in re letting static images sit on screen. Easy set-up, and again, wonderful picture.Edit Dec 2013 - thought I'd add a comment on the "soap opera" effect I was getting on multiple channels when watching regular cable TV - so did some reading - and went into the menus and turned anything connected w. led/auto motion OFF. Bingo, no more soap opera effect. (Tho supposedly this is the wave of the future for movies and TV). Added an article on this below, but there are many articles online besides these comments (e.g., it's not the TV, it's your settings - except the manual doesn't actually SAY turn this off if your Samsung TV picture looks like a soap opera...thank Gawd for the Internet and the tech people who post articles):"Soap Opera Effect is the name for the look when an HDTV uses motion interpolation, making movies and TV shows look like cheap video, similar to a daytime TV Soap.The reason the effect is produced is complicated, what's important is that you can turn it off.First look and see if you can set the native refresh rate on your HDTV, if so set it to 60 Hz.  See how your TV show looks now.  If you can't set the refresh rate, or if the picture still look soap like, then go down to the next step.Each TV maker has a different name for Motion Interpolation.  Here is a list of what manufactures call it (or look up manual online).Sony - Motion FlowSamsung - Auto Motion PlusSharp - AquoMotionToshiba - Clear Frame or Clear ScanVizio - Smooth MotionLG - TruMotionSanyo - Smooth MotionCheck the manual that came with your TV, or dig into your TV's menu until you see the Smoothing settings.  Set the motion smoothing to low or off if you can.  Does your TV shows look better, I hope so.Some TV's also have a function called Theater mode, this may work well too!So what is a high refresh rate or motion smoothing good for you might ask?  They make fast moving video and video shot higher than 24 fps look better such as professional sporting events, blu-ray movies that use a lot of computer animation, and video gaming."

Reviews.Title: Not perfect, but a good deal for the price
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I've only had this TV for a few days now so I can't comment on how it holds up over time, but so far I really like it overall.  The picture quality is outstanding, as is the price for a TV this size (I got it for $999 at Best Buy).  We use it primarily for gaming and didn't need all of the latest bells and whistles.The reasons why I am not giving it 5 stars:- The sound is not so great - it is kind of hollow and tinny. I have another 5 or 6 year old Samsung that is maybe half a step above this one in terms of features and delivers a much deeper sound.- The base does not swivel.  I have read descriptions where it does indicate that it is a swivel stand, but as far as I can tell it is not.- The glare can be really bad.  Where we have it now there are not many windows so it is not an issue, but I was contemplating swapping it with the older Samsung that we have which is in a room with many windows, but the glare was so bad that I had to put them back.- There is no audio output jack.  This can be remedied with an A/V receiver (which can also compensate for the minimal amount of input jacks), however it would be nice if it had one.But all things considered, I am satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture, Crappy Sound, No Sound Outputs
Reviews.Author: Matt Gilbert
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the quality of the picture, but extremely disappointed by the absence of any way to output the sound to a receiver. There are no sound output ports, and no support for HDMI Audio Return Channel. The built-in 10W speakers are substandard. Not recommended for those of us who use over-the-air signals without any means for outputting sound to an external amplifier.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money!
Reviews.Author: SuSeQ
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the money. I wanted a basic TV with a good picture and none of the "fluff" that comes with the "smart" tv models for less than 1k. My ROKU box handles all of the media streaming so I did not want to pay for the smart features. It's a 120hz panel so don't think you are getting a 240hz model because of the clear motion rate advertising 240. It will come set-up with all of the filtering and interpolation set high and it will have the "soap opera" effect. Don't worry it will go away if you adjust the settings. I have auto motion plus set on "clear", digital noise filter on "auto" and LED motion Plus set to "on" This seems to be the sweet spot where there is not too much DSP going on. Love the picture once it's set up properly. Like all new TV's there is no glare filter over the panel. My older tv's had them and it helped quite a bit. I was able to remove any glare simply by using a mount that angles the tv down slightly.  There are not many I/O points so if you don't do your HDMI switching with your receiver then I'd look at a different model. This TV can be found on sale for less than 1k and I found mine for $899 so don't pay more than $1k for it.

Reviews.Title: Great after calibration
Reviews.Author: Greg in Longwood
Reviews.Content: I want to make a few notes here to give you some background before reading further.- My TV is mounted on a wall between two windows that face east. The middle of the screen is at 5'10" height, so it's above eye level from the sofa. In the morning, the sun is very bright in the room, dimmer in the evenings and of course dark at night.- I used a receiver for all my audio and video switching. I also use a universal remote control. Thus, speaker quality, TV input/output options and the included remote mean nothing to me.- I am an IT pro with a decent base of technical knowledge, but I'm by no means an audio/video expert. I always look for a balance between performance and price. There is no way I'll ever pay more than $1000 for a big screen TV--never have, never will. And I don't dig through every specification of every TV... I find the TVs in my price range and go for the best of that bunch.Now, I love this TV. I didn't want to buy a Smart TV because I have a Roku, media center and satellite for any streaming and local media playback. As a matter of fact, I wouldn't pay a single penny more for a smart television because the streaming services will change over time, and I plan on keeping my TV for 7 years. For less than $100, you can buy a streaming device that is fully upgradeable and replaceable in the future. All I wanted was an 1080p screen with lots of acreage and of decent quality and that's what I got.The default settings on this TV are not atrocious, but are definitely not optimal. I followed the calibration steps from Lifehacker on my TV. It's been less than 24 hours and I know the settings may change due to "burn-in", so I'll recalibrate it in another few months to see if anything has changed. If you want to do the free calibration, just enter AVS calibration into your favorite search engine for the full method or use the Lifehacker article for ease. It takes a keen eye and familiarity with your TV settings, but doesn't take an engineer to improve from factory defaults.Below are the settings for my TV. Some will argue that I did something wrong, but I spent 90 minutes doing this and I am happy with the results. There is no perfect settings for all situations, and its really up to you what makes sense in your situation.My settings:Mode: StandardBacklight: 20 (yes, some of you will stop reading this after seeing that, but I like my whites to be white)Contrast: 45Brightness: 38Sharpness: 20Color: 70Tint: G38/R62Advanced settings:Color space: AutoWhite balance: left at 25 defaultGamma: +1Dynamic contrast: high (I use this because the brightness in my room varies a lot between morning and night. If you have a dark room or the TV is in a basement, definitely turn this off)Black Tone: DarkestFlesh tone: 0Motion Lighting: OffPicture Options:Color tone: Warm1Size: Screen Fit (This is probably the most important setting for everyone, otherwise your TV is overscanning and making the picture unnecessarily fuzzy)Digital Noise Filter: AutoFilm Mode: AutoAuto Motion Plus: Clear (This is completely a personal setting and I love it on Blu-Ray Disney movies but hate it 80% of the time... I wish there was a button on the remote to turn this on/off with a single click)LED Motion: Off (dimmed the picture and would require recalibration to enable)

Reviews.Title: Great TV.  Awesome deal for the money!  Picture is outstanding!
Reviews.Author: calc "calc"
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Awesome deal for the money!  Picture is outstanding!  60" is huge.  best picture you can get!  samsung makes the best HDTVs.  Not one stuck or broken pixel on the whole screen.  we have a half-dozen samsung screens, and none of them have a broken or stuck pixel.

Reviews.Title: Great picture. Need more hdmi inputs and one output.
Reviews.Author: Brian Wirth
Reviews.Content: Great picture. I wish the tv had more hdmi inputs and at least one output to hook up to the amp

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: C. Perrelli
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price. It has a great picture. I watched a bluray movie and the images are amazing. I use a 3D Bluray player with WIFI and apps so I do not need a smart tv and sort of a waste for me. I dont need to pay the extra cost.Yes the player has few HDMI inputs and outputs but I l spent the time to read that about the TV.The only issue was PILOT delivery service. Not a great company and I had to deal with some issues with them. I think that they should work on their processes.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Ecidemon
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this set, especially with he price that I paid for it, well worth the money and couldn't be happier with it or the condition. Great picture, and the sound is better than I expected given how small the speakers are. (I have a home theater set up so I didn't use them much)

Reviews.Title: Great for a "dumb" TV
Reviews.Author: The Ryan
Reviews.Content: We just needed a bigger screen for our new large family room.  We didn't need to jump on the internet or wave my hand at it like I'm using the force.  For a super clean, clear picture, this is it for the money.  Doesn't seem to have audio outputs for super surround sound, but I honestly haven't investigated too much.  For a flat screen, the speakers are sufficient to "just watch tv."  We have a dedicated movie theater in the house so we would probably never use surround on this tv to be the main movie watching area anyway.  For cartoons for the little one and news for us, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: I was a little uncertain about purchasing this TV.  But it seemed to be everything that I wanted 120 Mhz, High Def, Dumb (i.e. not a smart TV.  I have other devices that are smart Blu-Ray and Surround Sound)  minimal HDMI interfaces 2.  Again my surround sound system has 6 inputs I don't need more than two inputs in a TV and it was not a 3D TV All I need is another pair of glasses.  This TV has lived up to my expectations and exceeded them.  So far - So good!

Reviews.Title: Shipping was an issue, but the TV itself is AMAZING
Reviews.Author: SookieMom
Reviews.Content: I have placed more than a few orders with Amazon, and have never had the problems we had with this one before or since. We eagerly awaited the arrival from the moment we placed the order. There were some issues with the shipping that were beyond the control of the shipping company (when we checked the tracking it stated there was a train derailment, and continued to state that for several days) so we begrudgingly accepted that it would not likely arrive when expected, and when it did it may be damaged and need to be returned and replaced. We double checked because it was being shipped via a company we had never heard of before, and discovered that the TV was NOT in the train derailment at all, but was sitting at a shipping company on the other side of our state, with no address on the package, and no phone number listed??? (I get text message updates, and they were turned on for this item as well.) So we were able to have the item delivered rather late in the evening on the last day before they were going to send it back. I double checked my account and they just never put the shipping address on the package itself. All my info was in order.Once we got the tv, it was PERFECT! We have purchased other HDTVs in the past, and they have all had issues rebooting, or freezing, or whatever. This never had that issue at all. The tv is on nearly 24/7, we have been running it for more around 2 months like that, and not a single issue. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a large HDTV that meets the stats this one gives.

Reviews.Title: Great TV if your looking for a monitor with minimal inputs
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: I use this with a dedicated Media PC and audio receiver so I didn't want to pay extra for smart TV features or multiple inputs and outputs. I wanted to use this as basically just a huge monitor and its perfect for thatThe default picture settings do need some tweaking; the back lighting, gamma, brightness and contrast all needed some adjusting, but once that was done I was very happy with the picture.

Reviews.Title: Burn out after 6 monts
Reviews.Author: Robert Sarreal
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV last October 2012. 6 months later, the picture stopped working. The sound works but the picture is gone. The repair center said they will need to replace the board. This TV is hardly used and it's hard to believe that it will burn out after 6 months.I am waiting for the repair center to replace the parts. I'm hoping that the replacement parts will last longer than 6 months.

Reviews.Title: No audio output, really?
Reviews.Author: AK47 "VS 11 plus user"
Reviews.Content: Good picture quality but that's it!Only 2 HDMI input and 1 Component and No Audio output.  You gotta be kidding!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 60"
Reviews.Author: Naj
Reviews.Content: Only had it a week so cant really say too much about the T.V. Replacing a Visio 55" Razor that lasted less than 2 yrs. and cost me over $1400. Never again, stay away from Visio. So far this T.V. is simple to adjust and has a great picture quality and the sound i'snt bad either, was concerned about the sound quality because my Visio had a sound bar which was pretty good. Amazon is a top notch co. My delivery was free and came right to my front door into the living room, would of never got that huge box in my car.

Reviews.Title: Five stars for the price - Perfect "dumb" TV for your smart setup!
Reviews.Author: slugg
Reviews.Content: A lot of other reviews go into deep detail, so I'll keep this short.I bought this TV because it was simple: no "smart" features that age poorly and are forced upon you a few years from now. The other big part was that the TV is properly back-lit; it's not edge-lit like the super thin TVs of today. Keep in mind that this model uses slightly older technology, but this is a perfect example of the old saying, "they don't make 'em like they used to."Considering its price, it deserves 5 stars. Color representation is good, and easily adjustable, although not as good as the $5k+ displays. The 120hz refresh rate is, in fact, 120hz, so you won't get any judder from 24 FPS Blu-Ray playback. But, unlike the $5k displays, it's not 240hz, so no 3D playback. The speakers are good enough for a bedroom, but in this day and age, if you're buying a 60 inch display and plan to use the built-in speakers, then there's something seriously wrong with your priorities.*ALL* image processing can be disabled, including backlight dimming, motion smoothing, blur reduction, etc. This is great, because a lot of the time, these "enhancements" make some material look quite strange. One good thing, however, is that turning all motion smoothing off, but turning Judder Reduction to just one tick above zero actually does work 90% of the time without causing the dreaded Soap Opera Effect. This is especially useful while streaming Netflix movies that should be 24 frames per second, but Netflix has dubbed it to 30 FPS, causing judder.The entire purpose of this TV is to provide a good picture quality and decouples you from any one "smart" setup. Using this display simply as a monitor is the way to go. You maintain the freedom of switching to any set top box, blu-ray player, or otherwise "smart" device and the TV just remains simple.So, do keep in mind that I've rated this TV based on its price. For its price, it is definitely a 5 star product.

Reviews.Title: Samsung without speaker outputs
Reviews.Author: Mike 1900 "mike1900"
Reviews.Content: I just got this set and realized that there are no audio outputs. However after searching the net I discovered that an av receiver (home theater), should be the center of the whole system. The genie or vid box gets connected to it as well as speakers etc, then the signal is sent to the tv for broadcast via HDMI. The tv and other components are merely peripherals of the AV box. So i guess i need an AV receiver and my audio problems will be no more. Great set for the price.

Reviews.Title: FAST DELIVERY : GREAT PICTURE
Reviews.Author: Steve Thompson
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at who fast I got it and what a great picture. It has a better picture than my  forty inch tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Tiff
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV online because we got an awesome deal under $900 dollars and free shipping. The picture quality of this model TV is excellent and what we were looking for in a 60inch screen. There were a lot of people on this site that stated that this tv was unable to be hooked up to surround sound and that is why they took it back. That is untrue. My husband after about an hour was able to connect the tv to our surround sound Bluetooth receiver, blue ray player, and cable box. We are able to watch movies or tv through the tv speakers or surround sound. I graded it 4 out of 5 due to the fact that I believe that it should come with more outputs so it is not so complicated for people to hook up.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!
Reviews.Author: Bettye J. McKenna
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful product for simply watching great television.  Sharp picture, nice color.  Only has 2 HDMI ports but that is all I need.

Reviews.Title: Two year old model that still delivers great picture quality
Reviews.Author: MATTHEW C WONG
Reviews.Content: This model doesn't come with any of the bells and whistles but the picture quality is fantastic as a TV. If you are looking for a simple large flat screen TV, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with major shortcomings - new comments
Reviews.Author: Richard Ji
Reviews.Content: It's a great TV for the price I paid.  Nice pic.  Initial impression is judging from the remote, the functionality is less than my previous Samsung TV.  But my biggest concern is with the stand.  There is a piece that links the stand to TV which you will use 8 screws to secure it.  But even after some tightening it is wobbly if you touch the TV on the side a bit too much.  It doesn't give me too much comfort that it is solid.  I tested it by purposely shake my TV stand a bit and you can see the TV wobbly.  I guess this TV is more meant for wall mount than on a stand.Update after 1 month.  So I was wrong about the great picture comment.  The picture looked fine while I was watching TV, but when I started watching my 1080p movies such as life of pi or kings speech, the color is not rich at all, making the movie feels like it was shot using my $500 video cam.  I am gifting this TV to my parents since they just watch TV and going to pay for a nicer one.  Maybe at a brick and motor store so I can ensure the picture quality before I commit.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Black Screen of Death (actual term to Google search)
Reviews.Author: Kashif Ross
Reviews.Content: Yeah. Don't buy this. Goggle: Samsung black screen but sound.I hate to go to the extreme, but with a Note II and a Samsung TV that lost its picture after just four months, I'm not buying another Samsung product. Here's what happened: I got my first TV from Best Buy (I'll explain why Best Buy in a bit). After I took it home, there was a row of dead pixels. Not just a few, an entire row. Therefore, I returned the television and acquired a new one the next day.My second television worked great for four months. I will have to agree that Blu-ray disks don't have the greatest qualities. There's a bit of ghosting and the picture quality feels grainy. Fortunately, Nextflix movies have much higher quality. Actually, any streaming looks better than the actual disk. I'm using a PS3, so I can't say that it's the television's fault, but my LG had a better picture than certain scenes with this television.The story: This week, my wife and I skipped a few days with the television. When a friend was visiting, we turned it on and discovered the black screen with sound. I did some research and discovered that this is common for all Samsung televisions. There are even YouTube videos showing how you can replace the board. I tried resetting the television by unplugging it, but nothing worked.So why BestBuy? From previous experience, I knew that Samsung customer service needs some help. Not to mention, I'd have to ship out the television to get it fixed. Geek Squad is coming to me in order to analyze the problem, though I'm not confident in their ability to fix it. Either way, I have a better warranty than the standard.Go with Sony or anything else. The chance of this happening within two years is too high.

Reviews.Title: Not 120Hz, but 60Hz
Reviews.Author: Min Jae Hong
Reviews.Content: You said this TV is 120Hz HDTV by your information.But I found this TV is 60Hz HDTV by label which is attached to back of TV.I was fooled by you, Amazon.com.I ordered this TV on Dec. 2. 2013 and received it Dec. 30. 2013.I am in Korea, so it is difficult to refund it or return it to you.Don't you think this is some fraud?

Reviews.Title: I should have stayed with Vizio!
Reviews.Author: Shae930 "Shae"
Reviews.Content: The picture on the TV was great, then one week later there is a black jagged line across the top with, what looks like an ink blob in the upper right corner.Samsung customer service was terrible, and this TV does not work with the Samsung 5.1 CH HTF-4500 BluRay Home Theater I purchased! UUGGHHHH

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Campbell
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv online on Sunday and by Friday it was here safely, unpacked and set up.  The picture is great and its like watching a theatre movie.  It is perfect and I would order this one again.  It was just as easy to order from Amazon as to buy locally.  I not only saved money with Amazon, but it was delivered to my living room and unpacked for me.

Reviews.Title: *****WARNING:  DO NOT BUY SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS*****
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  Maybe $2,500.00 - $3,000.00 is not a lot of money for some folks to spend on a television, but it is to me.  This is money I'll never get back, nor derive true enjoyment, nor value from due to the DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG product that I purchased.  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems as in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as the same DEFECT in many other DEFECTIVE SAMUNG models.  This defect occurs upon start-up, and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture gets progressively worse over time and continuously declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00!Furthermore, I was informed that the repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel" that costs $1,300.00 for the part plus $279.00 to install, plus taxes......all told, another $1,719.16....at which point the technician basically stated, "just buy another TV."SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at a rate of 20% per year, and that they do not repair any of their products after 4 years!  Their own repair people told me to just buy a new set!!!If I save one family the heartache of losing they're hard-earned money on SYSTEMICALLY DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS, and a company that offers zero customer service....I'll be happy!  God bless....SAMSUNG CONS:No Customer SupportSystemic Panel DefectGhosting of imagesBurn-in on screenDistorted pictureVery expensive to repair

Reviews.Title: inaccurate product description
Reviews.Author: Tim h
Reviews.Content: Was labeled as 'good,' condition, but half of the picture was unviewable.  A wharehouse deal adventure. Would have kept it if picture was ok.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Packaging
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: Delivered damaged, i dont understand why it would be sent in just a flimsy cardboard box with no extra protection. the bottom corner of the tv was completely smashed, but looking at the box before it was opened, you would have thought it was perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: How do I rate this Product?
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I cannot give this product a fair review, because it arrived damaged, and there is not way I could turn the TV on and watch it, because the whole front panel was broken.  So, I cannot do anything.  It was a big disappointment having it come straight out of the box damaged as such, but I do realize that there is not way I can blame the product or the manufacturer or the store in which I purchased it from, because I am sure it was damage done in shipping.  I guess now I understand why there is free shipping !  No, not really, but the free shipping is definitely an incentive to buy.  I truly think I would have been very pleased with the TV.  I do think though, with another appliance such as this, I am not going to take the chance with shipping, and I will just buy locally.

Reviews.Title: After analyzing the price/features this is the one!
Reviews.Author: Sandra P Bass
Reviews.Content: I have done much research on all of the big tv's available and first settlrd on Samsung as the brand to go after. I didn't want 3D or Wi-Fi so it wasn't easy finding this model with just the features that I wanted. It is on it's way and I hope it gets here soon so that I can experience what it has to offer and see it for myself. I could not find any reviews for this specific model (un60eh6003) but if it is similar to the un60es6003 it should be a great tv. It is $200 cheaper than the ES model so perhaps it doesn't have the full array led backlighting. If I am not satisfied with the picture when I recieve it I will return it to get the ES model instead. Stay tuned for further review after I recieve it and play around with the settings to tweak the picture and sound to my satisfaction.Samsung 60" Class 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV

ProductInfo.Features:
1080p HDTV : Better picture quality
120Hz Refresh Rate: Better for general viewing and good for video games, action movies, and sports
TV without stand (Width x Height x Depth): 54.1 X 31.5 X 3.7 Inches, TV with stand (Width x Height x Depth): 54.1 X 33.9 X 12.9 Inches
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung UN60EH6003 60-Inch 1080p 120Hz HDTV (2013 Model)
